content: fyi: I went ahead and created two new labels to better categorize our bugs: L-false-positive and L-false-negative. Currently going through the open bugs and adding them where neccessary
@Takayuki Nakata It would be great, if you could also use those labels when labeling issues <3
What's the difference between a false negative and an enhancement?
'false negative' is "this should have been caught by the lint but wasn't"
'enhancement' is "the lint could be improved in some way" (probably diagnostics if I had to guess)
(and 'false positive' is "this should not have warned but did")

For example, I wouldn't know whether to call this a false negative or an enhancement.
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-clippy/issues/6423
Most enhancements amount to "this lint can catch another case"
ah hmm ok, I'm not sure then

Cameron Steffen said:

For example, I wouldn't know whether to call this a false negative or an enhancement.
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-clippy/issues/6423

IMO this should be both
I also noticed that issues are sometimes tagged as a bug and an enhancement. IMO a false negative is an enhancement and a false positive is a bug.

@Cameron Steffen if they're both, you can label them as both.

The most helpful labels are the difficulty labels of issues anyway. At least for contributors.

flip1995 said:

if they're both, you can label them as both.

Makes sense. I assume you're referring to false negative and enhancement.
